did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Larry Blagg gay club matchbook covers and ephemera, 1969-1989.
did.physdesc: Matchbook covers, business cards, membership cards.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Over 300 matchbook covers from gay bars, discos, private clubs, restaurants, and bathhouses across the United States. There are also over 30 business cards from these establishments and over 30 personalized membership cards from private clubs of the early 1970s in New York.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Blagg assembled this collection by visiting at least 90 percent of the establishments from which these items come. Friends who knew he was collecting matchbook covers from gay bars and clubs around the country gave him the rest. Blagg was a member of a number of private New York City clubs in the early 1970s.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Over 300 matchbook covers from gay bars, discos, private clubs, restaurants, and bathhouses across the United States. Most from the early 1970s are from New York City, and matchbooks from the 1980s are mostly from Los Angeles. Included are some from Germany in the 1970s. There are also over 30 business cards from these establishments and over 30 personalized membership cards from private clubs of the early 1970s in New York. These precursors to Studio 54 include Flamingo, 12-West, Buttermilk Bottom, Starship Discovery, Les Mouches, Galaxy 21, and Truck Stop.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Gift of the Cornell University Gay and Lesbian Alumni Association.
Collection was initially cataloged incorrectly as "Larry Bragg" and was corrected in June 2016.
